item.title: Indian economy to grow at 6.5% in FY26 and FY27: IMF - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Indian economy to grow at 6.5% in FY26 and FY27: IMF

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian economy is forecasted to grow at 6.5 percent for FY26 and FY27, according to the latest report by the International Monetary Fund (IMF). This projection holds steady from previous updates despite recent economic slowdowns.

  • The IMF maintains the growth forecast at 6.5% for the next two fiscal years.
  • The organization estimates a slight increase from the government's projection of 6.4% for FY25.
  • India's growth dipped to 5.4% in Q2 FY25, marking a low not seen in seven quarters.
  • Previous fiscal growth was at 8.2%, highlighting a significant slowdown.
“In India, growth is projected to be solid at 6.5 percent in 2025 and 2026, as projected in October and in line with potential,” - IMF.

Looking forward, these growth estimates reflect both challenges and potentials for the Indian economy in the coming years.

item.title: Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees - Mint
item.description:
Wipro Q3 attrition rate rises to 15.3%; headcount down by 1,157 to 2,32,732 employees

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Wipro Ltd reported a voluntary attrition rate of 15.3% for Q3 of the financial year 2024-25, up from 14.2% in the same quarter last year. The company’s headcount decreased by 1,157 to a total of 2,32,732 employees.

  • Consolidated net profits increased by 24.5% YoY to ₹3,353.8 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose nearly 1% to ₹22,319 crore.
  • Wipro declared an interim dividend of ₹6 per equity share, with a record date set for January 28, 2025.
“In a seasonally weak quarter, our strong in-quarter execution helped us deliver above the top end of our revenue guidance,” said Srini Pallia, CEO.

The company's shares dropped 2.15% to ₹281.85 ahead of the earnings announcement.

This increase in attrition and decrease in headcount suggests ongoing challenges in workforce retention within the IT sector.

item.title: Jio Financial Q3 Results | Net profit flat at ₹295 crore, revenue up 6% to ₹438 crore - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Jio Financial Q3 Results | Net profit flat at ₹295 crore, revenue rises 6% to ₹438 crore

Date: Jan 17, 2025

Source: CNBCTV18

Jio Financial Services Ltd (JFSL) reported a net profit of ₹294.8 crore for Q3 FY25, reflecting a marginal increase of 0.3% year-on-year, while revenues rose 6% to ₹438.4 crore.

  • Share price of JFSL closed at ₹279.05, up 0.83%.
  • The company's assets under management (AUM) increased significantly to ₹4,199 crore.
  • JFSL's customer base for CASA grew by 25% quarter-on-quarter to 1.89 million.
  • JFSL integrated payment solutions into JioBharat, enhancing its digital footprint with 7.4 million monthly active users (MAUs).
  • Marketing partnership established with MyJio app for customer acquisition.
“Shares of Jio Financial Services Ltd ended at ₹279.05, up by ₹2.30, or 0.83%, on the BSE.”

JFSL's results show steady growth despite flat profits, indicating a strong position in the digital finance sector.

item.title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Launches, unveils, and more from the event - news - The Financial Express
item.description:
Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Hyundai Creta EV launched at Rs 17.99 lakh, Maruti Suzuki eVitara unveiled, and Tata takes the stage with new EVs

Date: 2025

Source: Financial Express

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 is showcasing new electric vehicles from numerous manufacturers, including Hyundai, Maruti Suzuki, and Tata Motors.

  • Hyundai launched the Creta EV at a price of Rs 17.99 lakh.
  • Maruti Suzuki unveiled the eVitara and other upcoming models.
  • Tata showcased a range of electric vehicles including the Safari EV and Harrier EV.
  • Two-wheeler manufacturers are also present, unveiling models like the KTM 390 Adventure S and the all-electric Access scooter.
“Catch all the updates live from the 2025 Bharat Mobility Expo.”

This expo represents a significant advancement in India's electric vehicle market, emphasizing the increasing shift toward sustainable mobility.

item.title: Citi initiates coverage on Aadhar Housing Finance stock with ’buy’ rating, sees 42% upside - Mint
item.description:
Citi Initiates Coverage on Aadhar Housing Finance with Buy Rating, Projects 42% Upside

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Aadhar Housing Finance stock has received a 'buy' rating from Citi Research, reflecting a target price of ₹565 per share, indicating a potential growth of 42% from its current price of ₹398.

  • Citi projects Aadhar's growth at over 16% CAGR in the past 4-6 years.
  • The company commands 2% market share in the low-income housing finance segment.
  • Post-Blackstone acquisition, Aadhar has improved governance and growth metrics.
  • Plans to open 75 new branches in FY25 across various states.
  • Expecting disbursement growth to sustain AUM CAGR at 21-22%.
“The brokerage expects the share of self-employed customers to scale up by 1-2 percentage points annually over the medium term.”

Despite recent stock declines, Aadhar's stock remains up 26.3% from its IPO price of ₹315.

item.title: Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine? - News18
item.description:
Kalyan Jewellers Shares Fall 37% From All-Time Highs; Why Is The Stock Losing Its Shine?

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: News18

Shares of Kalyan Jewellers India Ltd have continued to decline despite the company denying rumors of IT raids and allegations of bribing fund managers. The stock started 2025 on a high note but has been on a downward trend, falling in 10 out of 13 sessions this year.

  • The stock dropped 6.63% on Friday, reaching a low of Rs 503.25, marking a 36.66% decline from its record high of Rs 794.60.
  • The stock has fallen in four out of five sessions this week.
  • Kalyan Jewellers is currently in "oversold" territory, with a Relative Strength Index (RSI) at 21.
  • The market capitalization has dropped from over Rs 82,000 crore to Rs 50,000 crore.
  • The company denied allegations of IT raids and labeled bribery rumors as “absurd.”
  • Recent financial measures include repayments of around Rs 450 crore of debt and a Rs 170 crore dividend payout.
  • The stock is approaching a key support level of Rs 515.
  • Kalyan Jewellers shares have delivered a positive return of 39% over the past year, with multibagger returns of 320% and 626% over two and three years, respectively.
“We have always maintained a high level of integrity and transparency in our business operations.” - Ramesh Kalyanaraman, executive director.

This decline in stock price indicates potential challenges for Kalyan Jewellers, despite past success and positive returns in a longer timeframe. Investors are advised to approach cautiously and stay updated on future developments.

item.title: 'Unacceptable': TMC MP Mahua Moitra demands refund of Rs 1,220 from Swiggy; company responds - The Times of India
item.description:
TMC MP Mahua Moitra Demands Refund of ₹1,220 from Swiggy

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

Mahua Moitra, a Member of Parliament from the Trinamool Congress (TMC), has publicly demanded a refund of ₹1,220 from the food delivery service Swiggy due to unsatisfactory service, prompting a response from the company.

  • Moitra criticized the service provided by Swiggy in her recent complaint.
  • The demand has generated considerable media attention and public discussion.
“This is unacceptable service, and I demand a refund.” - Mahua Moitra

Swiggy has acknowledged the complaint but has not yet confirmed whether the refund will be issued.

item.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results Highlights: Net profit jumps 93% YoY to ₹983 crore, revenue up 1.4% - Upstox
item.description:
Tech Mahindra Q3 Results Highlights: Net Profit Surges 93% to ₹983 Crore

Date & Source: January 17, 2023 | Tech Mahindra

Tech Mahindra has reported significant financial growth in Q3 FY25 with a 92.63% increase in net profit and a slight revenue growth amid fluctuating market conditions.

Key Points

  • Net profit rose to ₹983.2 crore, up from ₹510.4 crore YoY.
  • Revenue for the quarter reached ₹13,286 crore, a 1.4% YoY increase.
  • EBITDA increased by 57.8% to ₹1,809 crore.
  • Manufacturing sector declined by 7.2%, while BFSI segment grew by 8.3% YoY.
  • New deal wins increased to ₹74.5 crore compared to previous quarters.

Notable Quotes

“We delivered growth in EBIT margin and operating PAT, resulting from our targeted actions under Project Fortius,” said Rohit Anand, CFO.
“Our consistent expansion in operating margins reaffirms that we are on track to achieve our long-term goals,” said Mohit Joshi, CEO & MD.

Conclusion

Despite minor sequential declines, Tech Mahindra's substantial YoY growth illustrates a strong financial performance and commitment to strategic growth across key verticals.

item.title: WazirX freezes first set of stolen assets worth $3 mn - BusinessLine
item.description:
WazirX Freezes $3 Million of Stolen Cryptocurrency Assets

Updated - January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu Business Line

Six months after a significant cyberattack, WazirX announced the freezing of $3 million of stolen assets, moving closer to recovering funds for victims affected by the breach.

  • The theft on July 18 resulted in losses exceeding $230 million.
  • The cyberattack has had a negative impact on confidence in India's cryptocurrency ecosystem.
  • WazirX's parent company is collaborating with international law enforcement regarding the theft.
  • The attack has been attributed to North Korean hackers by several countries including the US, South Korea, and Japan.
“This is just the beginning; we are fully committed to recovering the stolen funds,” says Nischal Shetty, Founder of WazirX.

WazirX continues to work diligently to recover stolen assets and stabilize their cryptocurrency exchange operations.

item.title: Bad news for Narayana Murthy and Family, as they lost Rs 18500000000 after Infosys share price declined by… - India.com
item.description:
Narayana Murthy and Family Lose ₹18.5 Billion Due to Infosys Stock Decline

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 Source: India.com

A sharp decline of nearly 6% in Infosys Ltd stock has not only impacted the broader IT sector but also resulted in a significant loss for Narayana Murthy and his family, whose net worth dropped substantially.

  • The Murthy family collectively owns a 4.02% stake in Infosys, valued at approximately ₹30,300 crore following the stock drop.
  • Infosys shares fell by 5.89%, hitting a low of ₹1,812.70 on the BSE.
  • Despite reporting revenue growth, analysts express concerns regarding the sustainability of the performance due to economic factors.

The family's holdings were valued at around ₹32,152 crore a day before the drop, reflecting a notional loss of over ₹1,850 crore.

This decline underscores the volatility in the IT sector and the cautious outlook from investors, casting doubts over future performance.

item.title: Top Gainers and Losers today on 17 January, 2025: Reliance Industries, Bharat Petroleum Corporation, Infosys, Axis Bank among most active stocks; Check full list here - Mint
item.description:
Top Gainers and Losers Today - January 17, 2025

Publication Date: January 17, 2025

Source: Live Mint

The Nifty index closed at 23,311.8, down 0.47%, while the Sensex dropped 0.55% to 77,042.82. The Midcap and Small-cap indices showed better performance compared to the Nifty. Key gainers included Reliance Industries and Bharat Petroleum, while top losers were Infosys and Axis Bank.

Nifty Index Top Gainers and Losers

  • Top Gainers: Reliance Industries (up 2.83%), Bharat Petroleum Corporation (up 2.51%), Hindalco Industries (up 2.39%), Coal India (up 2.32%), Nestle India (up 2.21%)
  • Top Losers: Infosys (down 5.86%), Axis Bank (down 4.52%), Shriram Finance (down 3.71%), Kotak Mahindra Bank (down 2.60%), Mahindra & Mahindra (down 2.12%)

Performance Overview

Nifty 50 Returns: -1.0% (1 Week), -4.68% (1 Month), -6.27% (3 Months), -6.46% (6 Months), +7.54% (1 Year)

Bank Nifty: Closed at 49,278.7, down 0.43% (1 Week), -8.16% (1 Month), +5.34% (1 Year)

Full details on gainers and losers for Nifty MidCap 50 and Nifty Small Cap 100 are also discussed.

item.title: Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Cons PAT soars 93% YoY to Rs 983 crore, revenue up 1% - The Economic Times
item.description:
Tech Mahindra Q3 Results: Cons PAT soars 93% YoY to Rs 983 crore, revenue up 1%

Publication Date: January 19, 2025

Source: The Economic Times

Tech Mahindra has reported a remarkable 93% growth in consolidated net profit for Q3FY25, reaching Rs 983 crore. While revenue from operations saw a slight increase, there was a sequential decline in profits.

  • Consolidated net profit of Rs 983 crore for Q3FY25.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 1.4% to Rs 13,286 crore.
  • The company achieved TCV growth of 95.4% in new deals, totaling $745 million.
  • Sequentially, profits declined by 21% from Q2FY25.
  • EBITDA rose to Rs 1,809 crore, marking a 57.8% increase YoY.
The company witnessed an improved rate of deal wins in its key verticals, according to CEO Mohit Joshi.

The impressive annual growth in profit reflects Tech Mahindra’s strong performance in the IT services sector despite some sequential challenges.

item.title: Hyundai Creta priced at Rs 17.99 lakh, Co to set up 600 fast-charging stations - Autocar Professional
item.description:
Hyundai Creta EV Launched at Rs 17.99 Lakh

Publication Date: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Source: Hyundai Motor India

The Korean automobile manufacturer Hyundai has officially announced the launch of the Creta EV, priced at Rs 17.99 lakh, alongside plans for a nationwide fast-charging network.

  • The Creta EV offers two battery options: 42kWh with a 390km range and 51.4kWh with a 473km range.
  • It features a 0-100km/h acceleration in just 7.9 seconds.
  • The vehicle includes advanced safety features with over 75 tech-enabled functions and an extensive battery warranty.
  • A network of 600 fast-charging stations will be established across India.
“Fast charging networks are critical infrastructure that directly impact EV adoption rates.”

The Creta EV marks a significant milestone as Hyundai's first indigenous electric SUV in India, aiming to boost the electric vehicle market.

item.title: Wipro Q3 Results: Net profit rises 24.5% YoY to ₹3,354 crore; dividend declared - Mint
item.description:
Wipro Q3 Results: Net profit rises 24.5% YoY to ₹3,354 crore; dividend declared

Date: January 28, 2025
Source: Live Mint

Wipro Ltd has announced a significant increase in its net profit for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025, alongside the declaration of a dividend.

  • Consolidated net profit rose 24.5% year-on-year to ₹3,353.8 crore.
  • Profit in the previous year-ago period was ₹2,694.2 crore.
  • Quarterly revenue from operations recorded at ₹22,319 crore, a 1% increase from Q3FY24.
  • Interim dividend of ₹6 per share was declared.
  • Wipro shares ended at ₹281.80 with a drop of 2.17% on BSE.
“On Friday, Wipro filed a regulatory filing announcing an interim dividend of ₹6 per share.”

In conclusion, Wipro's strong quarterly performance indicates a positive trend in profitability, marking a robust start to the fiscal year.

item.title: Hero Xoom 125 launched at Rs 86,900 at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025 - BikeWale
item.description:
Hero Xoom 125 launched at Rs 86,900 at Bharat Mobility Expo 2025

Date & Source: Bharat Mobility Expo 2025

The Hero Xoom 125 has been officially launched at a price of Rs. 86,900 (ex-showroom). This scooter marks a significant design change for Hero.

  • New 125cc scooter from Hero
  • Features an external fuel filler cap
  • Equipped with an LCD instrument cluster and Bluetooth connectivity
“The design is a welcome departure from Hero’s previous scooters.”

In terms of features, the Xoom 125 includes all-LED lights and a fully digital instrument cluster.

It competes with the TVS Ntorq 125 and Suzuki Avenis.

item.title: Unique Honda Activa Launched At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Unique Honda Activa Launched At Auto Expo!

Date: January 2025 | Source: MotorOctane

Honda has finally unveiled the prices for its new Activa e: model at the Bharat Mobility Auto Expo 2025, set at Rs 1.17 lakh (ex-showroom).

  • New electric Activa model launched.
  • Price set at Rs 1.17 lakh.
  • Equipped with two swappable 1.5 kWh batteries.
  • Offers a range of 102 km.
  • Top speed of 80 kmph with 0-60 sprint in 7.3 seconds.
  • Three riding modes: Eco, Standard, Sport.
  • Features LED headlamp, touchscreen, and advanced connected tech.
“The new Activa e: sprints 0-60 in 7.3 seconds.”

The electric Honda Activa introduces significant features and aims to appeal to environmentally conscious consumers while maintaining its iconic design.
